name: Dungeon adventure
structure: Produces dungeon descriptions based on the 'Five Room Dungeon' formula.
note: Forked from the Five_room_dungeon generator on 2018-01-04.
to do: More external table calls to add variety.
authors: Esko Vesala, based on the 'Five Room Dungeon' formula, the Hero's Journey and scriptwriting methodology.
sources: Dream Park: The Roleplaying Game, Five_room_dungeon, RolePlayingTips.com

tables.name: adventure description
tables.explanation: The adventure described from start to finish.

tables.name: alternative adventure description
tables.explanation: This is an older model is based more strictly on the 'Five Room Dungeon' formula.

tables.name: adventure title
tables.explanation: The adventure name as a subheading.

tables.name: adventure name
tables.explanation: Variations for the name of the adventure based on set variables.
entries: In search of the {var:treasure} of the {villain adjective} {var:villain}

tables.name: introduction
tables.explanation: How the adventurers start the adventure.
entries: {arrival} {var:locationdescription}. Here the {lib:synonym#troupe} {encountering} {villain introduction} {var:villain} and a band of minions. Will the {lib:synonym#troupe} be able to {var:goal} {var:target}?

tables.name: arrival
tables.explanation: Introductory words about adventurers discovering the location.
entries: The {lib:synonym#troupe} has heard a rumour about

tables.name: encountering
tables.explanation: Introductory words about adventurers facing the villain.

tables.name: villain introduction
tables.explanation: Introductory words about the villain.

tables.name: duration notice
tables.explanation: A paragraph about the estimated duration of the adventure, based on the number of scenes.
entries: {var:para}[The duration of the {lib:synonym#adventure} is estimated to be roughly {var:duration} minutes.]

tables.name: footnote
tables.explanation: A potential footnote (usually empty).

tables.name: difficulty notice
tables.explanation: A paragraph describing the difficulty of the adventure.

tables.name: difficulty
tables.explanation: The difficulty level of the adventure.

set.difficultydescription: only the most experienced of adventurers

tables.name: villain
tables.explanation: Help table for randomizing the villain level. Usually the villain is defined via the difficulty table.

tables.name: villain level
tables.explanation: Enemies for adventurers of different experience levels.

tables.name: apprentice villain
tables.explanation: Enemies suitable to face apprentice adventurers.

tables.name: journeyman villain
tables.explanation: Enemies suitable to face journeyman adventurers.

tables.name: master villain
tables.explanation: Enemies suitable to face master adventurers.

tables.name: hero villain
tables.explanation: Enemies suitable to face heroic adventurers.

tables.name: legend villain
tables.explanation: Enemies suitable to face legendary adventurers.

tables.name: milieu
tables.explanation: The general environment of the location types by rarity.

tables.name: common
tables.explanation: Common milieu types.

tables.name: rare
tables.explanation: Rare milieu types.

tables.name: special
tables.explanation: Special milieu types (not produced by random).

tables.name: indoor location
tables.explanation: Locations inside buildings.

set.locationdescription: a hall built inside the city walls, where few have entered and even fewer returned
a mysterious chamber where bypassers suspect something strange is going on

tables.name: urban location
tables.explanation: Locations in a city.

set.locationdescription: a town whose inhabitants are in a dire need of help
a house where something evil hides
a temple hiding dark secrets
a hall built inside the city walls, where few have entered and even fewer returned
a mysterious chamber where bypassers suspect something strange is going on
a colossal monument built in ancient times
a shadowy undercity where life is cheap
a sewer complex built under the city

tables.name: suburban location
tables.explanation: Locations in the outskirts of a city.

set.locationdescription: an old prison building in a sparsely populated area

tables.name: rural location
tables.explanation: Locations in the countryside.

set.locationdescription: a country villge
a country manor where strange occurrences are said to happen
a grove of trees planted a long time ago
a complex maze structure built for an unknown purpose

tables.name: outpost location
tables.explanation: Locations in outposts, such as camps and fortifications.

set.locationdescription: a temporary camp
an encampment
a donjon that was once built to protect a nearby town
a lone, imposing tower
a lone keep built to guard the surrounding lands
a small fortress
a makeshift fortress
a temporary fortress built from logs
a fortress built to guard an ancient kingdom from its already forgotten enemies
a foreboding castle

tables.name: grassland location
tables.explanation: Locations on grasslands.

set.locationdescription: a sparse moor
a plot of land in the wilderness
an ancient underground tomb guarded by standing stones

tables.name: tundra location
tables.explanation: Locations in low temperature wilderness.

set.locationdescription: a remote wilderness where strange creatures roam
an uninhabited wasteland in the wilderness
treeless landscape with only small shrubs, moss and lichen growing on the ground

tables.name: forest location
tables.explanation: Locations in the woods.

set.locationdescription: a dense forest hiding dark secrets under its canopy
a mound in the middle of a dark forest

tables.name: rainforest location
tables.explanation: Locations in the tropical forests.

set.locationdescription: sparse soil shadowed by a thick canopy of trees and other vegetation
a dense jungle teeming with life

tables.name: savanna location
tables.explanation: Locations in the tropical grasslands.

set.locationdescription: a grassy plain with sparse trees
an isolated hill of jumbled rocks
a tall ground formation apparently build by termites

tables.name: desert location
tables.explanation: Locations in the desert.

set.locationdescription: hills formed from sand
a watering hole in the middle of the desert

tables.name: hill location
tables.explanation: Locations in the hills.

set.locationdescription: secluded hollow between hills
side of a hill
top of a hill

tables.name: mountain location
tables.explanation: Locations in the mountains.

set.locationdescription: a high mountain where few dare venture
an eyrie built on a high mountaintop
a remote vale hidden between impassable mountains

tables.name: river location
tables.explanation: Locations on running freshwater (rivers, streams, etc).

set.locationdescription: a ford in a stream
slow-moving stream entering a larger body of water

tables.name: lake location
tables.explanation: Locations on still freshwater (lakes, ponds, etc).

set.locationdescription: the shore of a lake
an isle in the middle of a lake

tables.name: wetlands location
tables.explanation: Locations on bogs, swamps, etc.

set.locationdescription: an unhospitable mire
an almost impassable, fetid swamp
a reeking bog
a seldom-ventured fen

tables.name: coastal location
tables.explanation: Locations on the coast.

set.locationdescription: a grotto formed by an underground water passage
a cove on the coastline

tables.name: naval location
tables.explanation: Locations on the sea.

set.locationdescription: a ship sailing to a far-off lands
a small island in the middle of a sea
sea with no land on sight

tables.name: glacial location
tables.explanation: Locations on snow and ice covered areas.

set.locationdescription: floating sheets of ice
a floating mountain of ice
ice-covered, sparse wilderness
snow-covered mountainside
a strange-looking ice formation in the cold, snow-covered wilderness

tables.name: underwater location
tables.explanation: Locations under the water surface.

set.locationdescription: the depths of the ocean
bottom of the sea

tables.name: underground location
tables.explanation: Locations under the earth's surface.

set.locationdescription: a deep, unexplored cave
an underground cavern
a lair where dwells something hostile
a tomb where dwells something that is not quite dead
an underground burial chamber
a disturbed burial site
a labyrinth built in a bygone age
a vault that is rumoured to contain {var:treasure}
an underground dungeon complex
a deserted mine that has been stripped off valuable ore
a deep underground pit from where strange emanations have been heard

tables.name: volcanic location
tables.explanation: Volcanic locations.

set.locationdescription: an uneven field of cooled down and hardened lava
a spring filled with steamy, hot water
a spring that intermittently discharges hot water and steam
a circular depression surrounded by steep cliffs
a mountain with multiple vents emiting flowing lava
a smoke-bellowing mountain
a crater on top of a smoke-bellowing mountain

tables.name: air location
tables.explanation: Locations in the sky.

set.locationdescription: high above the ground
a thick blanket of clouds

tables.name: space location
tables.explanation: Locations in outer space.

set.locationdescription: the cold emptiness of space
a mountain-sized rock hurling through empty space

tables.name: planar location
tables.explanation: Locations in other planes of existence.

set.locationdescription: a swirling etheral mass of vivid colors
an ethereal construction in the astral plane

tables.name: motif
tables.explanation: Theme of the adventure.

tables.name: location adjective
tables.explanation: A lurid descriptor for the location.

tables.name: goal
tables.explanation: The aim of the adventure.

tables.name: macguffin
tables.explanation: The object that draws the characters into the adventure.

tables.name: room 1
tables.explanation: There needs to be a reason why your dungeon hasn't been plundered before or why the PCs are the heroes for the job. A guardian or challenge at the entrance is a good justification why the location remains intact. Also, a guardian sets up early action to capture player interest and energize a session.

tables.name: entrance
tables.explanation: Entrance to the dungeon. Add mood and theme!
entries: The entrance is hidden by an overcrop of rock.
The entrance is guarded by {lib:actant#guardian} that keeps intruders out.
A {lib:actant#guardian} is not indigenous to the dungeon but has made its lair in room one.
A hazard prevents entering and requires special skills and equipment to bypass: {lib:hazard#detail}.

tables.name: door
tables.explanation: Doors barring the way.

tables.name: lock
tables.explanation: The key required to open the dungeon
entries: sigil requiring some kind of a ceremony to open
magical seal requiring a command word

tables.name: key
tables.explanation: The key required to open the dungeon

tables.name: tool
tables.explanation: Useful tools.

tables.name: trick
tables.explanation: Tricks to deceive the adventurers.
entries: A trick is played on the {lib:synonym#troupe}.

tables.name: clue
tables.explanation: Information helpful for solving the adventure.

tables.name: red herring
tables.explanation: Clues leading to a wrong direction.
entries: A false clue can be found here.

tables.name: smoke screen
tables.explanation: Coverups for something more important.
entries: A smoke screen covers an important detail.

tables.name: wonder
tables.explanation: Awe-inspiring sights evoking sense of wonder.
entries: Something wonderful is seen or experienced.

tables.name: humor
tables.explanation: Humorous happenstances.

tables.name: flavor
tables.explanation: Insignificant events that bring flavor to the setting.
entries: Something insignificant but flavorful is experienced.

tables.name: room 2
tables.explanation: The PCs are victorious over the challenge of the first room and are now presented with a trial that cannot be solved with steel. This keeps problem solvers in your group happy and breaks the action up for good pacing. Make Room Two a puzzle, skill-based, or roleplaying encounter, if possible. Room Two should shine the limelight on different PCs than Room One, change gameplay up, and offer variety between the challenge at the entrance and the challenge at the end. Note, if Room One was this type of encounter, then feel free to make Room Two combat-oriented. Room Two should allow for multiple solutions to prevent the game from stalling. Add clues to room 1!

tables.name: puzzle
tables.explanation: A trial that cannot be solved with steel.
entries: A dirt floor crawls with poisonous snakes that will slither out of the way to avoid open flame. (A few might follow at a distance and strike later on.)

tables.name: information gathering
entries: There is no obvious way to proceed, and the correct approach must be figured out via clues.

tables.name: magic puzzle
entries: {trap} The floor is covered from wall to wall with chessboard tiles. Stepping on wrong squares triggers a {var:trap}.

tables.name: roleplaying challenge
entries: A guardian spirit blocks access to the rest of the complex and must be befriended, not fought.
A {var:minion} standing on guard can be bluffed or coerced without raising the alarm.
The adventurers must convince a {var:minion} to let them in.

tables.name: room 3
tables.explanation: The purpose of this room is to build tension. Do this using a trick, trap, or setback. For example, after defeating a tough monster, and players think they've finally found the treasure and achieved their goal, they learn they've been tricked and the room is a false crypt. Depending on your game system, use this room to cater to any player or character types not yet served by the first two areas. Alternatively, give your group a double-dose of gameplay that they enjoy the most, such as more combat or roleplaying. Another potential payoff for Room Three is to weaken the PCs as build-up to a dramatic struggle in Room Four. It might contain a tough combat encounter, take down a key defense, exhaust an important resource, or make the party susceptible to a certain type of attack. For example, if Room Four contains a mummy whose secret weakness is fire, then make Room Three a troll lair (or another creature susceptible to fire) so the PCs might be tempted to burn off a lot of their fire magic, oil, and other flammable resources. This would turn a plain old troll battle into a gotcha once the PCs hit Room Four and realize the are out of fire resources. Don't forget to dress Room Three up with your theme elements!

tables.name: trick room
entries: The adventurers rescue a {var:captivegroup}. However, the {var:captives} {captive complication}.

tables.name: captive complication
entries: plead to be escorted back to safety immediately

tables.name: trapped room
entries: There is a {var:trap} in the room: {lib:trap#detail}.

tables.name: setback room
entries: A collapsed structure blocks part of the {lib:synonym#room}. The debris is dangerous and blocks {blocked area}.
{one way exit} leading back to room 1.

tables.name: complication room
entries: The {artifact} required to defeat the {var:villain}, but it is {artifact complication}. Clues reveal that a solution lies ahead.
Believing the object of the quest now lays within easy reach, a  companion turns traitor and betrays the {lib:synonym#troupe}.

tables.name: artifact
tables.explanation: Artifacts useful for solving the adventure.

tables.name: room 4
tables.explanation: This room is The Big Show. It's the final combat or conflict encounter of the dungeon. Use all the tactics you can summon to make this encounter memorable and entertaining. As always, generate interesting terrain that will impact the battle!

tables.name: climax
entries: The villain is here, ready to face the {lib:synonym#troupe}. Previous rooms have contained warning signals or an alarm, so the {var:villain} has had time to prepare.
The villain is here, and seems to be surprised by the arrival of the {lib:synonym#troupe}. The villain tries to settle things in an unusual way, through {unusual proposal}.
The villain is here and reveals the treasure to the {lib:synonym#troupe}, threatening to {reward threat}.
The villain is here, but has a weakness that the {lib:synonym#troupe} must figure out how to exploit.

tables.name: reward threat
entries: put it out of the reach of the {lib:synonym#troupe} so they'll never collect it

tables.name: big battle
entries: The villain is here and has unexpected {capabilities}.
The villain is here, but the {lib:synonym#room} is trapped. The villain {trap ability}.

tables.name: trap ability
entries: knows what to avoid in order to not trigger the traps
knows what areas to avoid in order to not trigger the traps
has the ability to set off the traps at opportune moments

tables.name: conflict
entries: A variety of skills and talents are required to successfully complete the encounter.

tables.name: roleplaying opportunity
entries: The {var:villain} needs to stall for time to {reason to stall}.
Combat ends with the {var:villain} bleeding to death and a few short words can be exchanged.
There is a helpless {var:captivegroup} to roleplay with once the threat is dealt with.

tables.name: room 5
tables.explanation: Here's your opportunity to change the players' bragging to 'we came, we saw, we slipped on a banana peel.' Room Five doesn't always represent a complication or point of failure for the PCs, but it can. Room Five doesn't always need to be a physical location either - it can be a twist revealed in Room Four. Room Five is where your creativity can shine and is often what will make the dungeon different and memorable from the other crawls in your campaigns. In addition, if you haven't supplied the reward yet for conquering the dungeon, here is a good place to put the object of the quest, chests of loot, or the valuable information the PCs need to save the kingdom. As accounting tasks take over from recent, thrilling, combat tasks, this would also be a good time to make a campaign or world revelation, or a plot twist.

tables.name: reward
entries: A {bonus treasure} is discovered that leads to another adventure.

tables.name: surprise
entries: A {var:monster} is hiding in the treasure container: {lib:monster#detail}
A trap that resurrects or renews the challenge from Room Four.

tables.name: revelation
entries: The location of the next adventure is uncovered, along with sufficient motivation to accept the quest.
The true identity of the {var:villain} is revealed.
New clues and information pertaining to a major plot arc are embedded in the treasure, {information hiding place}.
The {var:villain} is found to have a stronger, more fearsome master.
The grand scheme of the {var:villain} is discovered.
The source of an alien race's hostility towards others is uncovered, transforming them from villains to sympathetic characters in the story.
The true meaning of the prophecy or poem that lead the {lib:synonym#troupe} to the dungeon is finally understood, and it's not what the {lib:synonym#troupe} thought.

tables.name: information hiding place
entries: written on a slip of paper stuffed into a scroll tube
written using a cipher in the margins of a book

tables.name: plot twist
entries: A rival enters and tries to steal the reward while the {lib:synonym#troupe} is weakened after the big challenge of the previous room.
The object of the quest final reward isn't what it seems or has a complication. i.e. The kidnapped king doesn't want to return.
The quest was a trick. By killing the villain the {lib:synonym#troupe} has actually helped the {longterm villain}. The {var:villain} was actually {bad guy true form}.

tables.name: bad guy true form
entries: a good guy under a curse
a good guy placed into difficult circumstances

tables.name: room init
tables.explanation: Initializing the room parameters.

tables.name: room description
tables.explanation: Details of the dungeon room.

tables.name: room size
tables.explanation: The size of the area.

tables.name: room shape
tables.explanation: The shape of the area.

tables.name: room type
tables.explanation: Types or room.

tables.name: room purpose
tables.explanation: Help table for generating a completely random room purpose. Usually the 'room purpose' subtables are called directly by 'room size' to make the room purpose fit the room size.

tables.name: tiny room purpose
tables.explanation: The previous usage of a tiny room.

set.roomcontents: There are shackles fastened to one wall.
There are various types of clothes hanging from racks.

set.roomdescription: has been furnished into a bath
set.roomcontents: In the middle of the room there is a basin.

set.roomdescription: has served as a storage room
set.roomcontents: Chests and cases are filled with household items in various states of disrepair.

set.roomdescription: has been modified to function as a some kind of stall
set.roomcontents: There are piles of hay in a corner.

tables.name: small room purpose
tables.explanation: The previous usage of a small room.

set.roomcontents: There are shackles fastened to one wall.
There are various types of clothes hanging from racks.
There is a sarcophagus in the middle of the room.

set.roomdescription: has served as a treasure room
set.roomcontents: There are several chests on the floor.

set.roomdescription: has been furnished into a bath
set.roomcontents: In the middle of the room there is a basin.
A large bed lies next to the wall.

set.roomdescription: has apparently served as a bottlery
set.roomcontents: There are large casks in one corner and empty bottles in another.
Metalworking tools and base metal ingots are strewn on the floor.

set.roomdescription: has served as a storage room
set.roomcontents: Chests and cases are filled with household items in various states of disrepair.

set.roomdescription: has been modified to function as a some kind of a stable
set.roomcontents: There are several piles of hay in the corners.

set.roomdescription: has been used as a some kind of observatory

set.roomdescription: has been used as a torture chamber
set.roomcontents: The is a torture rack in the middle of the room and an iron maiden in a corner.
Several bookcases are filled with tomes and librams of various kinds.
There are astrological books and equipment strewn around.
There are several sarcophagi in the room.
On a table there are alembics and other alchemical paraphernalia.
There are various parts of armour in various states of repair lying on the floor.
There are several chests on the floor.
There are sparse beds around the walls.
A long table fills the center of the room.
A large bed lies next to the wall.

set.roomdescription: has apparently served as a bottlery
set.roomcontents: There are large casks in one corner and empty bottles in another.
There is a forge in the middle of the room.

set.roomdescription: is a scriptorium where books and manuscripts are copied

set.roomdescription: has served as a storage room
set.roomcontents: Chests and cases are filled with household items in various states of disrepair.

set.roomdescription: has been used as a some kind of observatory

set.roomdescription: has been used as a torture chamber

set.roomdescription: is a scriptorium where books and manuscripts are copied

set.roomdescription: holds plenty of water and apparently has served as a cistern

tables.name: huge room purpose

set.roomcontents: In the front of a room there is an altar.
In the center there is an open area and benches around the walls.
There are sparse beds around the walls.
A long table fills the center of the room.

tables.name: animal
tables.explanation: Animals encountered in dungeons to add some color.

set.animaldescription: Dark, bat-shaped forms fly all around.
A frog is croaking here, undisturbed by your presence.
A thick swarm of flies fills the air. They start to crawl oll over your skin, biting nastily.

tables.name: room extras
tables.explanation: A chance for extra features in the room.

tables.name: plant
tables.explanation: Plants growing in the dungeon room, adding some colour.

tables.name: adventure structure
tables.explanation: The path the adventure takes.

tables.name: duration
tables.explanation: The approximate duration of the game night.

tables.explanation: An adventure structure taking about 1.5 hours to play.
